results.title: A single life: Ethel May 'Monte' Punshon 1882-1989
results.creator_credit: Nancy Peck and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Produced with the assistance of the Australian Womens Archival Project, Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission, the interview filmed over two days in September 1988 when Monte Punshon was nearly 106 years old. The retired teacher of Japanese talks about her life and philosophy. She lived through two World Wars and two sightings of Hailey’s Comet. She was born in 1882 and died in 1989 at the age of 106. Monte squeezed several lifetimes into one, working as a governess, radio announcer, detention camp commander and author. She had a sixty year association with Japan, including being awarded one of Japan’s highest honours. A biographical guide to her life is included inside the video cover.

results.title: A Tale of mail
results.creator_credit: Donald Stearn, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film made in co-operation with the Canadian Post Office in which the artist has free rein to show how he thinks letters travelled from one place to another in the early days of transportation. A lively presentation of historical facts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Stearn, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Simple plan
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Adam Schroeder, James Jacks, Paramount Pictures and Mutual Film Company
results.brief_description: When three men (Bill Paxton, Billy Bob Thornton, Brent Briscoe) find a duffle bag full of money in a plane wreck in the Minnesota woods, they decide to hold onto it. If no-one claims the money they’ll divide it between them and leave town. If it is claimed however, they’ll burn it so that it can’t be traced to them. Even the simplest of plans can start to unravel though when there’s a 4.4 million secret at stake. A taught thriller which shows just what lengths some people will go to to acquire the American dream.

results.title: A Sunday in the Country = Un Dimanche a la Campagne
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Alain Sarde, Little Bear, Films A2 and Sara Films
results.brief_description: A poignant and gently paced portrayal of one day in the life of M. Ladmiral, a French painter nearing the end of his life. As is usual on Sundays, M. Ladmiral is visited at his country home by his children from the city - the devoted Edouard with his petit bourgeois wife and three children and the lively Irene, M. Ladmiral’s beautiful daughter. This Sunday, as the day unfolds, a telling family portrait is gradually revealed with the sensitivity that only Tavernier can bring to the screen.

results.title: A Streetcar named Desire
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Charles K. Feldman
results.brief_description: Blanche Dubois, a faded Southern belle whose fortunes have crumbled to nothing, comes to New Orleans to stay with her sister, Stella. Stella’s husband, the brutish but magnetic Stanley Kowalski is suspicious of her past and puts in train a devastating chain of events which will finally destroy for all time Blanche’s already tenuous grasp on the world of reality. Stars Vivien Leigh and Marlon Brando. Based on the play by Tennessee Williams. Also stars Karl Malden.

results.title: A Story of women = Une Affaire de femmes
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Marin Karmitz and MK2 Productions
results.brief_description:
‘Une Affaire de Femmes’ has been hailed as one of Chabrol’s finest films. Based on the true story of Marie-Louise Giraud, a wartime mother and abortionist. Since the age of fourteen, Marie has been married to Paul, and has been a devoted and dedicated wife. When Paul returns from the war, he finds that life has changed. Marie-Louise has kept the home and family together and has plenty of money from her illegal business. She decides she no longer needs or wants Paul. The film exposes hypocrisy in its political and personal manifestations. Isabelle Huppert and Francois Cluzet star in this film which won an award for Huppert at the Venice Film festival and which was voted best film at the Melbourne International Film Festival in 1989.
Cast also includes: Marie Trintignant, Nils Tavernier

results.title: A Stitch in time
results.creator_credit: Robert Asher, Hugh Stewart and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Norman Wisdom was famed for his ability to combine pathos and slapstick. In this motion picture he is an assistant to local butcher Mr. Grimsdale. During a hold up, Norman persuades Mr. Grimsdale to hide his gold watch in his mouth. This foolproof strategy comes unstuck when the watch is swallowed and Grimsdale has to be taken to hospital. Once there Norman is able to wreak havoc and chaos amongst patients and staff alike, but eventually his lovable charm wins the day and he manages to come out on top. Also stars Edward Chapman, Jerry Desmond and Lucy Appleby.

results.title: A Short portrait of obsession
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Jarrod Factor
results.brief_description:
A narrative about an artist who is torn between the film he is editing and the girl he loves.
Intriguing experimental piece with music soundtrack and no commentary - original music by Jarrod Factor.

results.title: A State funeral for Alec Campbell: the last Anzac
results.creator_credit: Greg Simson, Tracey Smith and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Described as charming, determined but also quite humble, a man of peace, widely respected and with many friends, Alec Campbell (1899-2002) was affectionately remembered as the last Anzac. He was born in Launceston, Tasmania, educated at Scotch College, Launceston and at the tender age of sixteen, successfully enlisted (by lying about his age) in the Army, in the 15th Battalion headed for Gallipoli. His time spent in Gallipoli was very brief - 2 months as a water carrier, but Alec has become part of the Anzac legend, however reluctantly, and on his passing on 16 May 2002 was given the honour of a State funeral as the last Anzac who fought in Gallipoli. This video is of the television broadcast of Alec Campbell’s State Funeral Service which was held at the Cathedral Church of Saint David in Hobart, Tasmania on Friday 24 May 2002. Hosted by Judy Tierney, Peter Gee and Lt. Col. John Moore, the program begins with a portrait of Alec Campbell’s life and achievements through interviews with his family and including stills, archival newsreel footage and family photos. This is then followed by a complete broadcast of the funeral service. A great tribute to a man who perhaps was somewhat bewildered by all the fuss and attention he received in his final years - a gentle man.

results.title: A Star named Ayrton Senna
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Guiter, Instituto Ayrton Senna and FOCA
results.brief_description: A Star Named Ayrton Senna is an insightful and intimate documentary about the Brazilian Formula 1 Champion who died tragically in May 1994. Includes interviews with Senna’s relatives and friends as well as people he worked with in the Grand Prix circuit. Fans of Ayrton Senna the man and also Formula One will enjoy the many frank interviews with Senna, as well as footage of him racing (including his days of racing Go-Carts!) and also his normal life away from the Grand Prix hysteria. Senna’s views on life and his professionalism are beautifully presented and the documentary also gives an interesting insight into the stresses and strains of fame. In English and Portugese with English subtitles.
